title: The Solar System
narration: Welcome to an exploration of our solar system Join us as we journey through space to discover the planets moons and other celestial bodies that orbit our Sun.

title: The Sun: Our Star
content:
The center of our solar system.
A massive ball of hot gas.
Provides light and heat to the planets.
narration: At the heart of our solar system lies the Sun a giant star composed mainly of hydrogen and helium. It generates immense energy through nuclear fusion providing the light and warmth necessary for life on Earth and influencing the orbits of all the planets. The sun's gravitational pull keeps all the planets in orbit.

title: Inner Planets: Rocky Worlds
content:
Mercury, Venus, Earth, and Mars.
Primarily composed of rock and metal.
Relatively small and dense.
image_desc: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars. Type: illustration
narration: The inner planets Mercury Venus Earth and Mars are characterized by their rocky composition and relatively small size. These planets are closer to the Sun and have solid surfaces making them distinct from the gas giants of the outer solar system. Earth is the only planet known to harbor life.

title: Outer Planets: Gas Giants
content:
Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
Composed mainly of gas and ice.
Much larger than the inner planets.
image_desc: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune. Type: illustration
narration: Beyond the asteroid belt lie the gas giants Jupiter Saturn Uranus and Neptune. These planets are significantly larger than the inner planets and are primarily composed of hydrogen helium and other gases. They also possess extensive ring systems and numerous moons making them fascinating objects of study.
